definition: name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
to go/to take/sentence-final interrogative particle/variant of 於|于[yu2]

sentences.english: The Singapore government is famous for its successful policy that everyone has its own house.
sentences.chinese: 新加坡政府因住者有其屋政策的成功实施而闻名于世。

sentences.english: Saxong is famous for its long history and rich cultural traditions.
sentences.chinese: 萨克森州以悠久的历史和丰富的文化传统而闻名于世。

sentences.english: Shanghai, known to the world as Oriental Pear, is China's eastern gate to the.
sentences.chinese: 以东方明珠闻名于世的上海市中国通向世界的东大门。

sentences.english: One of Milan's claims to fame is their fashion industry.
sentences.chinese: 米兰闻名于世的原因之一是它的时尚业。

sentences.english: With its simple artistic style and layout of the science and art of famous in the world.
sentences.chinese: 它以其古朴的艺术风格和科学的布局艺术闻名于世。

sentences.english: He performed outstanding military exploits and became famous as the resourceful one-eyed general.
sentences.chinese: 屡建战功，以足智多谋的“独目将军”闻名于世。

sentences.english: Villagers always heartily welcome the visitors and are known for their hospitality.
sentences.chinese: 村民以真诚欢迎游客的到来并以他们的好客闻名于世。

sentences.english: She is famous for her various literary perspectives and abundance of works.
sentences.chinese: 她以多样的文学视角和丰富的作品而闻名于世。

sentences.english: Vienna is also world-renown for its coffee houses.
sentences.chinese: 当然，久负盛名的咖啡厅也令维也纳闻名于世。

sentences.english: Since ancient times, Chinese were courteous image of modesty.
sentences.chinese: 自古以来中国人就以谦谦有礼的形象而闻名于世。

sentences.english: Emerson is most noted for leading the Transcendentalist movement of the mid-19th century.
sentences.chinese: 19世纪中期因领导超验主义运动而闻名于世。

sentences.english: Zhang Yining is famous in the world for her skills of playing pingpong.
sentences.chinese: 张怡宁以其乒乓球技术而闻名于世。

sentences.english: Kobe beef is a Japanese delicacy whose reputation precedes it.
sentences.chinese: 神户牛肉是日本闻名于世的一道佳肴。

sentences.english: Suzhou is known for its garden architecture.
sentences.chinese: 苏州园林建筑闻名于世。

sentences.english: Nanjing lives crossing the Yangtze River. The Yangtze River Bridge is well known all over the world.
sentences.chinese: 南京城跨江而居，南京长江大桥闻名于世。

sentences.english: Russian cuisine is famous for its soups, such as borscht and meat dishes.
sentences.chinese: 俄罗斯菜以它的各种汤和荤菜闻名于世。

definition: to be famous far and wide (idiom)
seasoned/honed to perfection over centuries/special reserve
to make a name/to become famous
to become known far and wide (idiom)/famous
